title: Which islands do Caribbean cruise lines visit?
text:
The Carnival Ecstasy, part of Carnival Cruise Lines' Caribbean fleet. © Carnival Cruise Lines 
Question: Which islands do Caribbean cruise lines visit? 
A big part of planning a cruise vacation to the Caribbean is deciding where you want to go. Pick a mega-ship and you'll generally be limited to the big ports that can accommodate these large vessels. Smaller ships offer more flexibility in terms of destinations... 
Answer: Caribbean destinations for each cruise line: Azamara Club Cruises : St. Kitts, Barbados, St. Lucia, Nevis, St. Barts, Saint Martin, Grenadines, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Antigua, British Virgin Islands Carnival Cruise Lines : Bahamas, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Turks & Caicos, Barbados, St. Lucia, St. Maarten, Grand Cayman, Jamaica Celebrity Cruises : St. Kitts, Belize,
